籤詩版本二:
Buddha's spiritual transformation and your knowledge
Idiots talk about things and turn into coma
The old man asked for a fortune teller
It's better to wait for the time
詩意: This hexagram is a symbol of keeping it constant and not moving. Everything comes at a favorable time.
解曰:
A perfect fortune. I'll give you my best. Don’t touch the old faith. It’s time to wait.
This is a full sign. Everything goes wrong. Great blessing. It can ensure peace.
籤詩故事一:
◇Three Religions Talk
During the reign of Emperor Wu of the Northern Zhou Dynasty, the three religions (Confucianism, Buddhism, and Taoism) were mutually exclusive. The emperor convened a general meeting and asked Confucianism, Buddhism and Taoism to debate. After three debates, no conclusion was reached.
This story is a metaphor: the three religions are one religion, a fool who is ignorant of reason, a forceful and argumentative person, and the actions of a fool.
聖意:
This is a full signature,
Everything goes wrong,
Great blessing,
It can ensure peace.
